title: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The BidiUtil class in org.eclipse.swt.internal has a line that uses `Class.forName()` to instantiate a `Callback` object with the arguments `BidiUtil.class` and "windowProc". This usage of `Class.forName()` is causing a `NoClassDefFoundError` in the CLDC version of SWT.
EB: The usage of `Class.forName()` should be replaced with a private constructor in the BidiUtil class. Since there are no non-static methods in the class, it is appropriate to make the constructor private to prevent unnecessary instantiation.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Use the CLDC version of SWT.
2. Verify or use jxeLink or similar.
3. Compile the code that references the `BidiUtil` class with `Class.forName()`.
4. Observe the `NoClassDefFoundError`.
